panels.description:
This panel also has airflow link and upstream link to the job in the tooltip.
Click on an operator to get the Airflow Link

âŒ means this link does not work

targets.rawSql:
select 
      opr.type , 
      opr.name, 
      meta,
      opr.status,
      extract( epoch from opr.start_time)*1000 as start, 
      extract( epoch from case when opr.end_time > now() then now() else opr.end_time end)  *1000 as end,
      opr.start_time  , opr.end_time 
      from (
  select *, REGEXP_REPLACE(name,'wait_(.*)-(.*)','\1')  as meta , 'sensor' as type from sensor_run 
  union all 
  select *, 'âŒ' as meta,  'task' as type from task_run 
  union all 
  select *, 'âŒ' as meta , 'hook' as type  from hook_run 
) as opr join job_run as jr 
on opr.job_run_id = jr.id 
where jr.scheduled_at = to_timestamp('$schedule_time', 'DAY DD/mm/yyyy HH24:MI:SS') and jr.job_name = '$job' 

union 
select 'delay' as type, 
      'schedule_delay' as name, 
      'âŒ' as meta, 
      'schedule_delay' as status,
      extract( epoch from scheduled_at)*1000 as start, 
      extract( epoch from start_time)  *1000 as end,
      scheduled_at as start_time  , start_time as end_time 
from job_run 
where scheduled_at = to_timestamp('$schedule_time', 'DAY DD/mm/yyyy HH24:MI:SS') and job_name = '$job'

union 

select 'SLA Definition' as type, 
      case when sla_definition = 0 then '' else 'SLA Definition' end as name, 
      'âŒ' as meta, 
      'sla_definition' as status,
      extract( epoch from scheduled_at)*1000 as start, 
      extract( epoch from scheduled_at)*1000 + sla_definition as end,
      scheduled_at as start_time  , 
      scheduled_at + (interval '1 sec' * sla_definition) end_time 
from job_run 
where scheduled_at = to_timestamp('$schedule_time', 'DAY DD/mm/yyyy HH24:MI:SS') and job_name = '$job'

panels.title: $job "$schedule_time" Job Timeline Gant

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  project_name, window_spec ->>'WindowSize' as WindowSize , schedule->'Interval' as Schedule, owner,
  CASE 
    WHEN labels::text LIKE '%critical%' THEN 'âš ï¸âš ï¸âš ï¸'
    ELSE 'No'
  END AS is_critical,
  labels , alert 
FROM
  job
WHERE name = '$job' and project_name in ($project)

panels.description:
Shows all upstreams of the selected job in project. Adhered filter:
* project
* job

External Jobs Link Are not supported , unless their Optimus is configured in ENV

targets.rawSql:
with job_schedule_cte as (
    select
        id,
        project_name,
        name,
        schedule::json -> 'Interval' as schedule_cron
    from job
),
job_upstream_cte as (
    select
        job_id,
        upstream_job_id as upstream_id,
        upstream_job_name as upstream_name,
        upstream_project_name, 
        case
            when upstream_external then 'ðŸŒŽ external'
            when not upstream_external then 'internal'
        end as _type,
        upstream_type as deduction_strategy
    from job_upstream
    where
        project_name in ($project) and
        job_name = '$job' and
        upstream_job_name != ''
)

select
    ju.upstream_project_name as project,
    ju.upstream_name as upstream,
    js.schedule_cron as schedule,
    ju.deduction_strategy as strategy,
    ju._type as type 
from job_schedule_cte js
join job_upstream_cte ju
    on js.id = ju.job_id;

panels.title: Upstream

targets.rawSql:
WITH RECURSIVE downstreams AS (
  SELECT
    job_name,
    project_name,
    upstream_job_name,
    1 AS level
  FROM
    job_upstream
  WHERE
    upstream_job_name = '$job'
    and upstream_project_name in ($project)
  UNION
  ALL
  SELECT
    ju.job_name,
    ju.project_name,
    ju.upstream_job_name,
    level + 1
  FROM
    job_upstream ju
    JOIN downstreams d ON d.job_name = ju.upstream_job_name
    and d.project_name = ju.upstream_project_name
    and level < 5
)
SELECT
  dj.job_name as job,
  dj.project_name as project,
  dj.level,
  CASE
    WHEN j.labels :: text LIKE '%critical%' THEN 'âš ï¸âš ï¸âš ï¸'
    ELSE 'No'
  END AS is_critical,
  j.labels, 
  schedule->'Interval' as interval 
FROM
  (
    select
      job_name,
      project_name,
      upstream_job_name,
      level
    from
      downstreams
    group by
      job_name,
      project_name,
      upstream_job_name,
      level
  ) dj
  join job j on dj.job_name = j.name
  and dj.project_name = j.project_name
ORDER BY
  is_critical,
  level desc;

panels.title: Downstream Direct or Indirect (5 level limit)

panels.description:
Shows the break down of job run based on duration of each operator. This panel adheres to filters:
* project
* job

targets.rawSql:
select
  jr.job_name,
  jr.scheduled_at,
  EXTRACT( epoch from jr.start_time - jr.scheduled_at) as schedule_delay,
  extract( epoch from case when now() < max(sr.end_time) then now() else max(sr.end_time) end - min(sr.start_time)) as upstream_wait_duration,
  extract( epoch from case when now() < max(tr.end_time) then now() else max(tr.end_time) end - min(tr.start_time)) as task_duration,
  extract( epoch from case when now() < max(hr.end_time) then now() else max(hr.end_time) end - min(hr.start_time)) as hook_duration,
  case when now() < max(sr.end_time) then true else false end is_sensor_stil_running,
  case when now() < max(tr.end_time) then true else false end is_task_stil_running,
  case when now() < max(hr.end_time) then true else false end is_hook_stil_running
from
  job_run jr
  left join sensor_run sr on jr.id = sr.job_run_id
  left join task_run tr on jr.id = tr.job_run_id
  left join hook_run hr on jr.id = hr.job_run_id
where
  $__timeFilter(jr.scheduled_at)
  and job_name = '$job'
group by 
  jr.job_name, 
  jr.scheduled_at, 
  jr.start_time 
order by 
  jr.scheduled_at

panels.title: Aggregate Operator Run Duration

panels.description:
Shows the pattern of job run duration based on the scheduled time. Adhered filters:
* project
* job

targets.rawSql:
SELECT scheduled_at, 
        start_time,
        status, 
        project_name,
        sla_alert as sla_breached,
        TO_CHAR(scheduled_at, 'DAY DD/mm/yyyy HH24:MI:SS') as schedule_time,
        EXTRACT(epoch from case when status = 'running' then now() - start_time  else end_time - start_time end) as duration
FROM 
  job_run
WHERE 
  $__timeFilter(scheduled_at) 
  and 
  project_name in ($project) 
  and 
  namespace_name in ($namespace)
  and 
  job_name = '$job'
order by scheduled_at
limit 100

panels.title: Job Duration Pattern

panels.description:
Shows the job statuses for each scheduled time in relation to its SLA. The filters it adheres to are:
* project
* job

targets.rawSql:
SELECT scheduled_at, 
        case when sla_definition = 0 then float8 'Infinity' else sla_definition end as user_defined_sla, 
        sla_alert as sla,
        status as job_state
FROM 
  job_run
WHERE 
  $__timeFilter(scheduled_at) 
  and 
  project_name in ($project) 
  and 
  namespace_name in ($namespace)
  and 
  job_name = '$job'
order by scheduled_at
limit 60

panels.title: Job Run State

panels.description: percentage failure in the selected time window

targets.rawSql:
with job_labels as (
    SELECT
        job.name as job_name,
        job.project_name as project_name,
        extracted_labels.value as job_label
    FROM job, jsonb_each(job.labels) extracted_labels
    where
        project_name in ($project) and
        namespace_name in ($namespace)
)

SELECT  jr.job_name, 
        100 * sum(case when status = 'failed' then 1 else 0 end ) / count(*) failure_percentage,
        sum(case when status = 'failed' then 1 else 0 end )  failure_count,
        sum(case when status = 'success' then 1 else 0 end )  success_count,
        count(*) total_runs_count
FROM 
  job_run jr
join job_labels jl
on
  jr.project_name = jl.project_name and
  jr.job_name = jl.job_name
WHERE 
  $__timeFilter(jr.scheduled_at) 
  and 
  jr.project_name in ($project) 
  and 
  jr.namespace_name in ($namespace)
  and
  jl.job_label in ($label)
GROUP BY jr.job_name
having 100 * sum(case when status = 'failed' then 1 else 0 end ) / count(*) > 0
ORDER BY failure_percentage  desc , failure_count desc
limit 20

panels.title: worst health jobs (failure percentage)

panels.description:
Shows the number of resources in use. Adhered filters:
* project
* namespace

targets.rawSql:
with job_sources as (
    select
        name as job_name,
        unnest(sources) as resource_name
    from job
    where
        project_name in ($project) and
        namespace_name in ($namespace)
),
split_job_sources as (
    select job_name, string_to_array(resource_name, '//') as split_resource_name
    from job_sources
),
cleaned_job_sources as (
    select job_name, replace(split_resource_name[2], ':', '.') as resource_name
    from split_job_sources
)

select
    resource_name, count(job_name) as job_downstream
from cleaned_job_sources
group by resource_name
order by job_downstream desc;

panels.title: Resource Usage

targets.rawSql:
with job_labels as (
    SELECT
        job.name as job_name,
        job.project_name as project_name,
        extracted_labels.value as job_label
    FROM job, jsonb_each(job.labels) extracted_labels
    where
        project_name in ($project) and
        namespace_name in ($namespace)
)

SELECT
  ju.project_name , ju.job_name,  ju.upstream_resource_urn

FROM
  job_upstream ju
join job_labels jl
on
  ju.project_name = jl.project_name and
  ju.job_name = jl.job_name
Where 
  ju.upstream_state = 'unresolved' 
  and ju.upstream_type = 'static'
  and ju.project_name in ($project)
  and jl.job_label in ($label)

select sum(extract(epoch from duration)) as agg_duration, time from 
(
  SELECT
    -- job_run_id, name , 
    case when max(end_time) < now() then max(end_time)-min(start_time) else interval '0' end duration, 
    date_trunc('hour', min(start_time)) as time 
  FROM
    sensor_run
  WHERE
    $__timeFilter(start_time)
  Group by 
    job_run_id, name
) as temp
Group by time 
order by time

with job_labels as (
    SELECT
        job.name as job_name,
        job.project_name as project_name,
        job.owner as owner,
        extracted_labels.value as job_label
    FROM job, jsonb_each(job.labels) extracted_labels
    where
        project_name in ($project) and
        namespace_name in ($namespace)
)

SELECT 
  TO_CHAR(scheduled_at, 'DAY DD/mm/yyyy HH24:MI:SS') as schedule_time,
  jr.project_name, 
  jr.job_name, 
  jr.status, 
  jl.owner,
  now() - jr.start_time  as duration 
FROM 
  job_run jr 
  join job_labels jl on jr.job_name = jl.job_name 
WHERE 
  $__timeFilter(jr.scheduled_at) 
  and jr.project_name in ($project) 
  and jr.namespace_name in ($namespace) 
  and jr.status = 'running'
  and jl.job_label in ($label)
order by now() - jr.start_time desc 
limit 10

with job_labels as (
    SELECT
        job.name as job_name,
        job.project_name as project_name,
        extracted_labels.value as job_label
    FROM job, jsonb_each(job.labels) extracted_labels
    where
        project_name in ($project) and
        namespace_name in ($namespace)
)

SELECT 
        date(jr.scheduled_at) as time,
        sum(case when jr.sla_alert = 'true' then 1 else 0 end ) as sla_miss_count,
        sum(case when jr.sla_alert = 'false' then 1 else 0 end ) as sla_success_count, 
        count(*) as total_runs_count,
        100 * sum(case when jr.sla_alert = 'true' then 1 else 0 end ) / count(*) failure_percentage
FROM job_run jr
join job_labels jl
  on
  jr.project_name = jl.project_name 
  and
  jr.job_name = jl.job_name
WHERE $__timeFilter(jr.scheduled_at) 
and jr.project_name in ($project) 
and jr.namespace_name in ($namespace)  
and jr.sla_definition > 0 
and jl.job_label in ($label)
GROUP BY jr.project_name,jr.namespace_name, date(jr.scheduled_at)

with job_labels as (
    SELECT
        job.name as job_name,
        job.project_name as project_name,
        extracted_labels.value as job_label
    FROM job, jsonb_each(job.labels) extracted_labels
    where
        project_name in ($project) and
        namespace_name in ($namespace)
)

SELECT  date(jr.scheduled_at),
  sum(case when jr.status = 'failed' then 1 else 0 end ) failure_count,
  sum(case when jr.status = 'success' then 1 else 0 end ) success_count,
  count(*) as total_runs,
  100 * sum(case when jr.status = 'success' then 1 else 0 end ) / count(*) success_percentage,
  100 * sum(case when jr.status = 'failed' then 1 else 0 end ) / count(*) failure_percentage
FROM job_run jr
join job_labels jl
on
  jr.project_name = jl.project_name and
  jr.job_name = jl.job_name
WHERE 
  $__timeFilter(scheduled_at) 
  and jr.project_name in ($project) 
  and jr.namespace_name in ($namespace)
  and jl.job_label in ($label)
  and ( jr.status = 'failed' or jr.status = 'success' )
GROUP BY date(jr.scheduled_at)

with job_labels as (
    SELECT
        job.name as job_name,
        job.project_name as project_name,
        extracted_labels.value as job_label
    FROM job, jsonb_each(job.labels) extracted_labels
    where
        project_name in ($project) and
        namespace_name in ($namespace)
)


SELECT
  TO_CHAR(jr.scheduled_at, 'DAY DD/mm/yyyy HH24:MI:SS') as schedule_time,
  jr.project_name , jr.namespace_name , jr.job_name 
FROM
  job_run jr
join job_labels jl
on
  jr.project_name = jl.project_name and
  jr.job_name = jl.job_name
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(jr.scheduled_at) 
  and jr.project_name in ($project) 
  and jr.namespace_name in ($namespace)
  and jl.job_label in ($label)
  and status = 'failed' 
  order by jr.scheduled_at;

panels.title: Failed jobs in given time window

targets.rawSql:
with job_labels as (
    SELECT
        job.name as job_name,
        job.project_name as project_name,
        extracted_labels.value as job_label
    FROM job, jsonb_each(job.labels) extracted_labels
    where
        project_name in ($project) and
        namespace_name in ($namespace)
)

SELECT
  TO_CHAR(jr.scheduled_at, 'DAY DD/mm/yyyy HH24:MI:SS') as schedule_time,
  jr.project_name, jr.namespace_name, jr.job_name , jr.sla_definition
FROM
  job_run jr
join job_labels jl
on
  jr.project_name = jl.project_name and
  jr.job_name = jl.job_name
WHERE
  jr.sla_alert = 'true'
  and jr.project_name in ($project) 
  and jr.namespace_name in ($namespace) 
  and $__timeFilter(jr.scheduled_at)
  and jl.job_label in ($label)

panels.title: job runs that breached SLA definitions

targets.rawSql:
with job_labels as (
    SELECT
        job.name as job_name,
        job.project_name as project_name,
        job.owner as owner,
        extracted_labels.value as job_label
    FROM job, jsonb_each(job.labels) extracted_labels
    where
        project_name in ($project) and
        namespace_name in ($namespace)
)


SELECT 
  TO_CHAR(jr.scheduled_at, 'DAY DD/mm/yyyy HH24:MI:SS') as schedule_time,
  jr.project_name, 
  jr.job_name, 
  jr.status, 
  j.owner,
  jr.end_time - jr.start_time as duration,
  jl.job_label
FROM 
  job_run jr 
  join job j on jr.project_name = j.project_name 
  and jr.job_name = j.name 
  join job_labels jl on j.name = jl.job_name
WHERE 
  $__timeFilter(jr.scheduled_at) 
  and jr.project_name in ($project) 
  and jr.namespace_name in ($namespace) 
  and jr.status != 'running'
  and jl.job_label in ($label)
order by jr.end_time - jr.start_time desc 
limit 10

panels.title: top 10 concluded jobs by longest duration

targets.rawSql:
with stuck_sensors as (
  SELECT
    TO_CHAR(jr.scheduled_at, 'DAY DD/mm/yyyy HH24:MI:SS') as schedule_time,
    sr.name as sensor_name,
    jr.job_name,
    case
      when max (sr.end_time) > now() then now() - max (sr.end_time)
      else max(sr.end_time) - min (sr.start_time)
    end duration,
    --min(sr.start_time) as wait_start,
    --case when max (sr.end_time) > now() then null else max (sr.end_time) end end_time,
    count (*) as attemps
  FROM
    sensor_run sr
    join job_run jr on sr.job_run_id = jr.id
  WHERE
    $__timeFilter(sr.start_time)
    and sr.end_time < now()
  group by
    sr.name,
    jr.job_name,
    sr.job_run_id,
    jr.scheduled_at
  order by
    max(sr.end_time) - min(sr.start_time) desc
  limit
    100
)
select
  s.*,
  count(*) as "No. â†“stream",
  STRING_AGG(ju.job_name, ' , ') AS "â†“streams"
from
  stuck_sensors s
  join job_upstream ju on ju.upstream_job_name = s.job_name
group by
  s.sensor_name,
  s.job_name,
  s.schedule_time,
  s.duration,
  s.attemps
order by   s.duration desc, "No. â†“stream" desc

SELECT 
  sr.name as sensor_name,
  jr.job_name,
  TO_CHAR(jr.scheduled_at, 'DAY DD/mm/yyyy HH24:MI:SS') as schedule_time,
  count (*) as attemps,
  min(sr.start_time) as wait_start,
  now() - min (sr.start_time) as running_since
FROM 
  sensor_run sr join job_run jr on 
  sr.job_run_id = jr.id
WHERE 
  $__timeFilter(sr.start_time) 
  and sr.end_time > now() 

group by sr.name,  jr.job_name, sr.job_run_id ,jr.scheduled_at
order by count (*) desc
limit 200

list.definition: select name from namespace where project_name in ($project)
list.name: namespace
list.query: select name from namespace where project_name in ($project)

list.definition: SELECT distinct(stuff.value) result  FROM job, jsonb_each(job.labels) stuff where project_name in ($project) and namespace_name in ($namespace);
list.name: label
list.query: SELECT distinct(stuff.value) result  FROM job, jsonb_each(job.labels) stuff where project_name in ($project) and namespace_name in ($namespace);

list.definition: select name from job where project_name in ($project) and namespace_name in ($namespace)
list.name: job
list.query: select name from job where project_name in ($project) and namespace_name in ($namespace)

list.definition: select TO_CHAR(scheduled_at, 'DAY DD/mm/yyyy HH24:MI:SS')  from job_run where job_name='$job' and   $__timeFilter(scheduled_at) order by scheduled_at
list.name: schedule_time
list.query: select TO_CHAR(scheduled_at, 'DAY DD/mm/yyyy HH24:MI:SS')  from job_run where job_name='$job' and   $__timeFilter(scheduled_at) order by scheduled_at

title: Optimus Job Monitoring  End User ( Interactive )
